channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supreme Court press corps asks chief justice to live-stream court's opinions
item.description: The press corps' letter was sent to the chief justice a year ago, but there has been no response.

item.title: Trump says a U.S.-China trade deal is 'done'
item.description: After talks in London this week, the two countries say they're largely going back to a framework they already agreed on in May.

item.title: Drag performers plan to protest Trump's attendance of 'Les Mis' at the Kennedy Center
item.description: The drag performers are expected to attend the musical alongside Trump, who after changing leadership at the Kennedy Center, said he would end drag sh...

item.title: Photos: See the dazzling pictures of June's Strawberry Moon
item.description: A strawberry moon occurs during the time of year when strawberries fully ripen.

item.title: What is the status of DOGE now that Elon Musk is gone?
item.description: Washington Post Reporter Hannah Natanson says DOGE's mass firings made the government more inefficient. She also explains the risks of DOGE creating a...

item.title: Brian Wilson, co-creator of iconic 1960s band The Beach Boys, dies aged 82
item.description: "We are heartbroken to announce that our beloved father Brian Wilson has passed away," his family said in a statement.

item.title: Watch Live: Harvey Weinstein guilty of criminal sexual assault as jury reaches partial verdict
item.description: Weinstein was convicted of one of two counts of criminal sexual assault. The jury told the judge they hadn't reached a verdict on the third degree rap...

item.title: Trump claims rare earths deal 'done' with China
item.description: The world's two biggest economies have agreed in principle a framework for de-escalating trade tensions.

item.title: Syria government says women must wear burkinis at public beaches
item.description: The rules are aimed at "enhancing public safety standards and preserving public decency", state media reports.

item.title: How James Dean will be brought back to life for future film
item.description: One famous actor is about to take on a new role, even though he's been dead for decades. Screen legend James Dean will star in an upcoming production ...

item.title: Women declare war on high heels in Japan
item.description: There is an outcry on social media after a number of Japanese companies reportedly banned female employees from wearing eyeglasses to work. The contro...

item.title: Brian Wilson, Beach Boys visionary leader and summer’s poet laureate, dies at 82
Boy whose father and nine siblings were killed in Israeli strike goes to Italy for treatment
item.description: Adam al-Najjar is evacuated to Milan, where surgeons can work to save his arm which was severely damaged in the attack.

item.title: Hundreds arrested as calm returns to Los Angeles
item.description: Police in the city say they have made mass arrests, as a war of words between the president and California's governor ramps up.

item.title: Ongoing impact for Kurds after U.S. withdraws from Syria
item.description: The U.S. has strongly condemned recent Syrian and Russian airstrikes that killed civilians in northwest Syria. Syrian and Russian forces have moved in...

item.title: Audible brings jobs, hope to Newark, New Jersey
item.description: Newark, New Jersey has seen its share of hard times. Most recently, like Flint, Michigan, it's found itself battling a lead water crisis, but a lot is...

item.title: Police arrest more than 20 people on first night of curfew aimed at protests in downtown Los Angeles
item.description: Police arrested more than 20 people, mostly on curfew violations, on the first night of restrictions in downtown Los Angeles.

item.title: What to know about the protests over Trump’s immigration crackdown in LA and other cities
